Experiment.Name: DTU:Emotion:001
Experiment.FooterLabel: For questions or comments contact us via this {{link|mailto:jenma@dtu.dk?subject=Comment%20about%20DTU:Emotion:001&body=%0D%0A%0D%0A%0D%0A%0D%0A%0D%0AExperiment%20ID%0D%0A(e3cc09b6-f3ee-af3c-0001-000000000002)|e-mail}}.

Instrument.Text: {{n}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|Thank you for your interest and your participation in this listening experiment.}}}}{{n}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|The experiment focuses on the emotions expressed in music.}}}}{{n}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|It will take approximately 30 minutes to complete. You can follow your progress in the bottom right corner.}}}}

Context.Data: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:30.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/30.0

Instrument.Text: {{n}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|The experiment concentrates on rating musical excerpts using the emotions expressed in the music.}}}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|The emotions expressed in music are different from how the music makes you feel.}}}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|So focus on what emotions the music expresses and try the best you can not to rate excerpts based on how the music makes you feel.}}}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|For example, you think some music sounds very negative, but for some reason the music makes you feel positive.}}}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|Then you should not rate it as being positive but rather negative, since this is what you think the music expresses.}}}}{{n}}

{{n}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|To capture the emotions expressed in the music we will ask you to use the two aspects of {{b|valence}} and {{b|arousal}}. }}}}{{n}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|{{b|Valence}} is described as the aspect of emotions in music that ranges from }}}} {{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|(unpleasant/bad/negative) to (pleasant/good/positive) }}}} {{n}}{{n}}{{n}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|{{b|Arousal}} is described as the aspect of emotions in music that ranges from }}}} {{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|(sleepy/tired/drowsy) to (alert/wakeful/awake) }}}} {{n}}{{n}}{{n}}{{n}}
{{n}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|These are the scales you will use to rate each of the musical excerpts.}}}}

Instrument.HeaderLabel: {{center|{{style|font-size: 25px;|Valence scale}}}}
{{center|{{style|font-size: 25px;|Arousal scale}}}}

Instrument.Text: {{n}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|The experiment will be as follows, you will first answer some personal information about yourself.}}}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|After this you will be asked to listen to a number of excerpts and rate them on the valence and arousal scales.}}}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|After each rating, you will be asked to answer how sure you were of your rating.}}}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|Please carefully (re)evaluate each excerpt, even if you are asked to rate the same excerpt more than once.}}}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|Remember this is not a test, there is no such thing as right or wrong answers so please answer honestly on all ratings.}}}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 14px;|{{n}}{{n}}{{n}}Data collection and analysis is performed in accordance with the Danish Act of Processing of Personal Data.}}}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 14px;|No sensitive or confidential data (name, address, social security number etc.) is saved after the completion of the experiment.}}}}{{n}}

{{n}}{{center|Please adjust the volume so that the music is played at a pleasent level}}. {{center|After you have found an appropriate listening level, please refrain from adjusting the volume throughout the experiment}}

Instrument.HeaderLabel: Have you adjusted the volume appropriately?

Instrument.Text: Please answer the following questions about yourself.

Instrument.Label: What instrument(s) do you play? (seperate by comma)

Instrument.Text: Please answer the following questions about yourself.

Instrument.HeaderLabel: Do you have any hearing disorders
How many hours a day do you actively listen to music? {{n}}{{style|font-size: 20px|(i.e. you select what music to listen to)}}
How many hours a day do you passively listen to music? {{n}} {{style|font-size: 20px|(e.g. radio, premade playlists, etc.)}}?
How many years of musical training have you had? {{n}} {{style|font-size: 20px|(e.g. playing an instrument, theoretical training, etc.)}}
How many hour(s) a day do you play an instrument?
How many times have you participated{{n}}in a listening experiment before?
How many times have you participated{{n}}in a listening experiment regarding emotions and audio?

Instrument.Text: For the following items, please indicate your basic preference level for the genres listed using the scale provided.

Instrument.HeaderLabel: Classical
Blues
Country
Dance/Electronica
Folk
Rap/hip-hop
Soul/funk
Religious
Alternative
Jazz
Rock
Pop
Heavy Metal
Soundtracks/theme songs
How would you rate your own mood right now on the {{n}}{{n}} Valence scale
How would you rate your own mood right now on the {{n}}{{n}} Arousal scale

Instrument.Text: {{n}}{{n}}{{center|{{style|font-size: 16px;|Now we are ready to start the experiment}}}}{{n}}
